informal_interpretation: Returns the byte representation of a compressed Edwards Y point.
Compresses an Edwards point to its canonical 32-byte encoding.
Decompresses a 32-byte encoding to an Edwards point (if valid).
Checks whether a point has small order (lies in the torsion subgroup).
Multiplies a point by the cofactor (8) to clear the torsion component.
Negates an Edwards point (group inverse).
Converts an Edwards point to its Montgomery u-coordinate.
Computes a double scalar multiplication with the basepoint (variable-time).

math_interpretation: u -> (x,y) in E(F_p), birational map M -> E
informal_interpretation: Converts a Montgomery point to its Edwards representation (with sign).
Returns the byte representation of a compressed Ristretto point.
Compresses a Ristretto point to its canonical 32-byte encoding.
Constant-time equality comparison of two compressed Ristretto points.
Decompresses a Ristretto encoding to a point (if valid).
Returns the default (identity) Ristretto point.
Constructs a compressed Ristretto point from a byte slice.
Returns the compressed identity Ristretto point.
Scalar multiplication of a Ristretto point.
Scalar multiplication of the Ristretto basepoint.
Negates a Ristretto point.
Subtracts two Ristretto points.
Returns the byte array of a compressed Ristretto point.
Returns a reference to the scalar's byte representation.

math_interpretation: clamp: clear bits 0-2 and 255, set bit 254
informal_interpretation: Clamps a 32-byte integer for use as an X25519 scalar.
Constant-time equality comparison of two scalars.
Equality comparison of two scalars.
Converts a u64 integer to a Scalar.

math_interpretation: b -> LE(b) mod L, L = group order
informal_interpretation: Constructs a Scalar by reducing a 256-bit integer modulo the group order.
Constructs a Scalar by reducing a 512-bit integer modulo the group order.

math_interpretation: b -> Some(s) if LE(b) < L else None
informal_interpretation: Constructs a Scalar from canonical bytes (rejects non-canonical).
Constructs a Scalar from a 64-byte hash output reduced mod L.
Hashes input bytes with SHA-512 and reduces to a Scalar.

math_interpretation: s -> s^(-1) mod L, multiplicative inverse
informal_interpretation: Computes the multiplicative inverse of a scalar modulo the group order.
Negates a scalar modulo the group order.
Returns the canonical byte encoding of a scalar.
